title: Ilham Aliyev
added: {{See also|Azerbaijan and the United Nations}} Ilham Aliyev visited [[UN Headquarters]] several times: to attend and address the general debates of the 59th session of the [[United Nations General Assembly|UN General Assembly]] in September 2004;<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=http://files.preslib.az/site/ialiyev/2004.pdf|title=Speeches of the President of Azerbaijan Ilham Aliyev - library of President's Administration|last=|first=|date=|website=|access-date=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.un.org/webcast/ga/59/statements/azeeng040924.pdf|title=Text of the Speech in UN webpage|last=|first=|date=|website=|access-date=}}</ref> the 65th session in September 2010;<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://gadebate.un.org/sites/default/files/gastatements/65/65_AZ_en.pdf|title=Text of the Statement in UN session|last=|first=|date=|website=gadebate.un.org|access-date=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://files.preslib.az/site/ialiyev/2010.pdf|title=Speeches of the president of Azerbaijan - Library of President's Administration|last=|first=|date=|website=|access-date=}}</ref> and the 72nd session in September 2017.<ref name=":4">{{Cite web|url=http://files.preslib.az/site/ialiyev/2017.pdf|title=Speeched of the President of Azerbaijan - Library of President's Administration|last=|first=|date=|website=|access-date=}}</ref> During the presidency of Ilham Aliyev, Azerbaijan was elected as a non-permanent member of [[United Nations Security Council|UN Security Council]] from the group of Eastern European states on October 24, 2011 for the term of 2012–2013.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.un.org/apps/news/story.asp?NewsID=40174#.Wgv749WWZp8|title=UN News - Azerbaijan wins final vacancy on Security Council|last=Section|first=United Nations News Service|date=2011-10-24|website=UN News Service Section|access-date=2017-11-15}}</ref>

Following the initiative of President Aliyev,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://en.president.az/articles/20772|title=Official web-site of President of Azerbaijan Republic - NEWS» Meetings Azerbaijani, Iranian and Russian presidents hold trilateral meeting|website=en.president.az|access-date=2017-08-23}}</ref><ref name="President of Russia">{{Cite news|url=http://en.kremlin.ru/events/president/news/52666|title=Trilateral meeting of the presidents of Azerbaijan, Iran and Russia|work=President of Russia|access-date=2017-08-23}}</ref> for the first time<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.euronews.com/2016/08/08/putin-in-baku-for-talks-with-azerbaijan-and-iran|title=Putin in Baku for talks with Azerbaijan and Iran|last=Hackwill|first=Robert|date=2016-08-08|website=euronews|access-date=2017-08-23}}</ref> the trilateral summit between Russian, Iranian and Azerbaijani leaders was held in Baku in 2016 for purpose of fighting against terrorism, transnational organized crime, arms smuggling and drug trafficking in the region.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/leaders-of-russia-iran-azerbaijan-discuss-closer-ties/|title=Leaders of Russia, Iran, Azerbaijan discuss closer ties|work=The Times of Israel|access-date=2017-08-23}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.usnews.com/news/business/articles/2016-08-08/putin-eager-to-talk-trade-with-leaders-of-iran-azerbaijan|title=Leaders of Russia, Iran, Azerbaijan discuss closer ties|last=|first=|date=|website=|access-date=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://eadaily.com/en/news/2016/08/10/russia-azerbaijan-and-iran-are-building-new-geopolitics-in-the-region|title=Russia, Azerbaijan and Iran are building new geopolitics in the region: EADaily|work=EADaily|access-date=2017-08-23|language=ru}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.dailyherald.com/article/20160808/business/308089876/|title=Leaders of Russia, Iran, Azerbaijan discuss closer ties|last=Press|first=Associated|work=Daily Herald|access-date=2017-08-23}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.rferl.org/a/azerbaijan-iran-russia-presidents-meet-baku/27909041.html|title=Presidents Of Azerbaijan, Iran, And Russia Meet In Baku|website=RadioFreeEurope/RadioLiberty|access-date=2017-08-23}}</ref> Presidents of Azerbaijan, Iran and Russia through trilaterally signed declaration pledged to develop the strategic transnational project, the International North-South Transport Corridor, which would run from India all the way to St. Petersburg in Russia, providing a faster and cheaper alternative to existing sea routes.<ref name="President of Russia"/><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://tass.com/world/892981|title=Baku to host first trilateral meeting of Russian, Azerbaijani, Iranian presidents|work=TASS|access-date=2017-08-23|language=ru}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.azernews.az/nation/100606.html|title=Azerbaijani, Russian, Iranian presidents sign Baku summit declaration [ PHOTO]|date=2016-08-08|work=AzerNews.az|access-date=2017-08-23}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.geopolitica.ru/en/agenda/russian-iranian-and-azerbaijani-leaders-meet-first-time-history|title=Russian, Iranian, and Azerbaijani leaders meet for first time in history|website=Geopolitica.RU|access-date=2017-08-23}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://azeridaily.com/analytics/21439|title=Ilham Aliyev changes world map (First assessment)|access-date=2017-08-23}}</ref> The next trilateral meeting held in 2017, the leaders exchanged views on mutual relations in the fields of transit and energy.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.presstv.com/Detail/2017/11/01/540576/Iran-Russia-Azerbaijan-Tehran|title=PressTV-Tehran set to host Iran-Russia-Azerbaijan summit|last=|first=|date=|work=|access-date=2018-11-16}}</ref>
